message.content:
cs.AR, cs.PF, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.DC

This paper proposes a new design for on-chip communication using hierarchical ring networks. As such, it could fit into several arXiv CS sub-categories. 

cs.AR (Architecture) is the most likely category, as the paper is focused on designing a new interconnect architecture for on-chip communication. 

cs.PF (Performance) is also likely, as the paper discusses the performance of the proposed design and compares it to other designs. 

cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is another possible category, as the paper is concerned with interconnects and network topologies. 

cs.SY (Systems and Control) is a less likely category, but still possible, as the paper discusses the design of a system for on-chip communication. 

cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is also a less likely category, but could apply as the paper discusses a distributed communication system within a chip.
